fullText:
https://www.wsj.com/articles/hadestown-review-a-musical-heats-up-broadway-11555547401

ShareResizeAmber Gray and the Broadway cast of ‘Hadestown’ Photo: Matthew MurphyNew York

Does the Broadway musical have a future? Only if a new generation of artists walks away from the old-hit-movie-into-stale-new-stage-show model and starts creating musicals that are conceptually more ambitious. “The Band’s Visit” and “Be More Chill,” which also broke free from the twin strangleholds of by-the-numbers pop-rock and synthetic Disneypop, both filled the bill in their very different ways. So, too, does Anaïs Mitchell’s “Hadestown,” which has transferred to Broadway after highly acclaimed runs at New York Theatre Workshop and London’s Royal National Theatre. “Hadestown” isn’t perfect, but it’s so fresh that you’ll gladly look past its forgivable flaws and savor the kaleidoscopic stylistic variety of Ms. Mitchell’s score.

Copyright ©2023 Dow Jones & Company, Inc. All Rights Reserved. 87990cbe856818d5eddac44c7b1cdeb8

dtliExcerpt:
“Hadestown” isn’t perfect, but it’s so fresh that you’ll gladly look past its forgivable flaws and savor the kaleidoscopic stylistic variety of Ms. Mitchell’s score...Mitchell’s down-home score is the incontestable star of the show...Mitchell’s songs are beautiful but undramatic...Chavkin’s endlessly varied direction and Neumann’s dances help to keep things on the move...Would that ‘Hadestown’ were a bit shorter, too, but there’s no point in fussing over a show as rich as this one.”

Read more

keyPhrases.quote: it's so fresh that you'll gladly look past its forgivable flaws
Mitchell's down-home score is the incontestable star of the show
there's no point in fussing over a show as rich as this one

llmScore.reasoning: Claude: Despite acknowledging flaws like length and undramatic songs, the critic emphasizes the show's freshness, richness, and stellar score, ultimately dismissing concerns as minor 'fussing' over a worthwhile production. | GPT-4o-mini: The review expresses strong appreciation for the music and direction while acknowledging some flaws, leading to a positive recommendation overall.
